metadata.Title: CVE-2017-10690 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In previous versions of Puppet Agent it was possible for the agent to retrieve facts from an environment that it was not classified to retrieve from. This was resolved in Puppet Agent 5.3.4, included in Puppet Enterprise 2017.3.4

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-10690` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

puppet - 3.8.5-2ubuntu0.1
puppet-common - 3.8.5-2ubuntu0.1
puppet-el - 3.8.5-2ubuntu0.1
puppet-testsuite - 3.8.5-2ubuntu0.1
puppetmaster - 3.8.5-2ubuntu0.1
puppetmaster-common - 3.8.5-2ubuntu0.1
puppetmaster-passenger - 3.8.5-2ubuntu0.1
vim-puppet - 3.8.5-2ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> per Debian, only affects puppet 5.x

criterions.comment: puppet package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.8.5-2ubuntu0.1').
